author: King_K_Rool_

text:
Never, in any video game I've played, have I heard a theme that fit the character as much as this. And it's also one of the most poignant hymns I've heard in my life, too. Needless to say that even if it is taken from a video game, it is on my Top 3 of the Best Songs of All Time.

Also, a shameless plug for two awesome YouTubers that played this theme a few days back for piano and violin : Verdegrand and ViolinTay. Go and see it for yourselves if this sounds like a winner to you.
author: MarcASamson

text: It's very simple, the music of Chrono Cross never really lives up to the scenes where they are placed. Magus' theme is accompanied by the lighting of candles, the howling of wind, and his failed summoning of Lavos. Glenn's theme is accompanied by his awesome entrance to slay the Naga. Lucca's theme is accompanied by her awesome entry to save Crono. Robo's theme is accompanied by his awesome reactivation. None of that ever occurs in Chrono Cross. Everyone remains nameless.
author: thisbarb

text:
@Arc13 Oh, and, on the back of Chrono Cross' case, it even says "20 years after the events of Chrono Trigger.."

If that's not a direct sequel, I don't know what is. lrn2read
author: genesisSOC

text: @TheBaron87YT You spoke the words out of my mouth my friend. I'm glad you understand how insulting Cross was.
author: genesisSOC

text:
Cross, on the other hand, was one of the most ambitious games I've played.  Following up with a sequel to one of the most beloved games to date and completely changing every aspect that made the original so popular took balls, and I give credit to Square for wanting to create a completely new world for the series.  That said, it was a very flawed game.. Emotionally, it was cold and distant.  It was missing that "something" that made Trigger so amazing.  

I appreciated it more than I liked it.
author: chuppachoppa

text:
I want to chime in my two cents regarding Cross and Trigger.  

For me, Trigger is a timeless, priceless piece of gaming that will be remembered and cherished as one of the greatest and most epic adventures of all time.  It's one of the rare pieces of entertainment that transports me back to a specific place and time of my life, and is an experience that I will fondly remember until the day I die.
author: chuppachoppa

text: @assgoblin2damax but there's no way a blinded Cross fanboy would ever understand the amazingness of Trigger. Go love your terrible game, and revel in the fact that it's because of your piece of crap sequel, that Chrono is now dead.
author: genesisSOC

text: @assgoblin2damax The creators of the Chrono series proved my statements RIGHT. They wanted to change it so drastically different from Trigger, to "fix what's not broken," and because of it, Cross sold terribly and it's BECAUSE of that choice that Chrono is now dead. Trigger is DEFINITELY the best RPG on the SNES, with FF6 being a close runner up, as well as Super Mario RPG. But Trigger is the second best game of all time, many gamers understand that. Cross doesn't stand up to Trigger at all,
author: genesisSOC

text: @assgoblin2damax Let's take the example from the music we're listening to now.  Frog's valorous theme, one of the most memorable from this game.  When you hear it, it should bring an image of a frog-man with a big ol' sword cleaving a mountain in half in his quest.  He's memorable, well designed, and has meaning to the story.  There's 45 playable characters in Chrono Cross, with their own miniquests and reactions to the game's events, but most of them are not memorable or important.
author: DevilTakeMe

text: @assgoblin2damax See, the thing is that for all of Chrono Cross' amazing achievements, it has not stood the test of time as well as Trigger has.  Cross is still a classic from the PS1 but few people actually remember why.  I played the hell out of that game, and it's hard to really remember what made it different, aside from the spellcasting system.  With Chrono Trigger, it was clearly the story and the events from the game that truly stand out.
author: DevilTakeMe

text: @assgoblin2damax Chrono Cross is certainly not the "best RPG on the Playstation" either, but that's not the point.  The point is that Chrono Cross and Chrono Trigger are both considered classics because they are the most innovative and most unique RPGs - pushing the envelope of technology for their time, and providing an experience that no one else ever came close to achieving.
author: DevilTakeMe

text: @genesisSOC   Even the creators of the Chrono series proved your statements wrong.  It's pretty apparent when the creator of the series says, "Cross is Cross, and not Trigger 2" and "we didn't want to directly extend Chrono Trigger into a sequel, but create a new Chrono with links to the original".  Chrono Trigger was great for it's time but it still wasn't even the best RPG on the SNES and it certainly doesn't stand up to Cross when viewed by anyone who isn't a blinded Trigger fanboy.
author: assgoblin2damax

text: I think you've used like a fourth of all the music in Chrono Trigger.
author: David E.

text: @Arc13 It's not a new entry and SE KNOWS it's it. They just remade it on DS to see if it would sell because they knew that CT > CC. Cross -is- a sequel, it takes place years after Trigger, it even has Masamune, Crono, Marle, and Lucca in it. Heck you go back in time and visit Lucca's house with Gato and everything! It's a true-blooded sequel to Chrono Trigger. Heck Lucca's drawing is in the opening! I hate Chrono Cross and I can't ever say it enough. Trigger is my childhood!
author: genesisSOC

text: @genesisSOC You may not accept that as a new entry. I don't either, but SE does & that's where it matters. Why? Cause they're the millionaires who only need the 3 main series to stay rich. I'm responding because I've tried to stay calm but seriously, what is the point of being on this video bitching about a game you hate rather than recalling good times with the game the video is about? Cross got falsely advertised as a sequel when it's more of a spin off. Please, just stop, & enjoy the music.
author: Arc13

text: @Arc13 Believe you me, I WANT another Chrono. Knowing they'd have a money additude toward things with the DS version, I got 5 copies to help with it's sales. However by about $100 thousand FF4 for DS beat it, so it's uncertain... (Way I see it, selling around $900,000 for a game you've remade 50 times with no updates is a freaking miracle that not even Ocarina Of Time has pulled so why can't they accept it is just as popular? Hate to admit it, but they have turned ultra greedy...)
author: Arc13

text:
@Arc13 It didn't update the series afterward... They threw Chrono Trigger on DS like, what, 10+ years after Cross came out? Even Front Mission, Star Ocean, and Ogre Battle got more love than Chrono. Yet most people agree that Chrono Trigger, along with Zelda: Ocarina of Time, is the best game of all time.

SO WHY WOULD THE BEST GAME OF ALL TIME NOT HAVING ANY MORE GAMES COMING OUT? Simple, Cross screwed it over.
author: genesisSOC

text: @genesisSOC Then why is it that Square has continued to update the series afterward? Chrono isn't dead. I'll admit it's close, the point I'm trying to get across is you're missing a lot of facts if you think it's just 100% gone & never going to return in any shape or form ever again. The leading reason to Square not working more with Chrono is they've claimed they prefer series wise to stick with 3 major series at a time. FF, DQ, & KH. Thus, Chrono must pass those in sales to get recognition.
author: Arc13

text: love Frog! love chrono trigger! woooooh
author: watchdog2007

text: @Arc13 Um, no. The problem is that Chrono Trigger sold amazingly well and everyone loved it on the SNES. Then Cross came out and radically changed everything that made Chrono Trigger so good and so many people hated it that it wasn't received well, thus it's Cross' fault that Chrono has died.
author: genesisSOC

text: @genesisSOC You misread. Don't send me after any links either, cause I'm on that series like a vulture on a carcass. They said something to that effect, but about the new CT for the DS. The fact that was made alone is proof enough wherever you got that source of Cross information was false since they continue to do more with Chrono. Problem and issue is that it takes about 5-10 years for anything new to ever show up.
author: Arc13

text: @TheRealVordox It's not slime, it's mucus. I spelled that wrong, I don't care.

text:
